intro: Tachigali rigida var. argentata, commonly known as silverleaf tachigali, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its silvery-white undersides on its leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elongated, woody pods containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or secondary forest areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
